intro: Acinodendron anisophyllum, commonly known as the variable-leaf acinodendron, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its simple, opposite, and often variable in shape leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round berries. Its leaves are typically leathery and may have a slightly aromatic scent. Acinodendron anisophyllum is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats.
